WRITING.TEXT: Ah, yea makes total sense...

I totally agree. The DZ gives me a thrill like no other game I've played. It's a love/hate relationship. To be candid, that fine line between friendly and foe is what keeps the DZ fresh for me. Just wish the trash talk wasn't this bad. It's worse than COD and I left COD for that reason.
Same here. The only reason I go rogue is by pure accident. Wish there was a flag for accidental rogue instead of displaying 19 secs.
And at what point did I get too serious? And why are you so butt hurt about posts you don't like that you feel the need to retort with something juvenile as "fucking retarded"?
Oh no I still love this game. And I'm fully aware and accept the DZ for what it is. That's half the fun.
The perfect anthem.

WRITING.TITLE: The Devil Is In The Detail
WRITING.TEXT: I freakin love this game simply for the fact that Massive has taken the time to make sure every detail is accounted for. It makes for a truly immersive experience. Here are a few of my faves: -Foot prints left on the snow -The barrel of the gun burning red hot after a mag dump -Snow collecting on your clothes -Graffiti art that could pass as legit in real life (finding new ones everyday) -Civilians mourning their loss -Bars and restaurants with full menus -Textures everywhere -Environment destruction -Dense fog -And of course dogs pooping in the street ***Looks like a lot of agents are equally observant. Awesome to see that their hard work wasn't put to waste.
That makes total sense. Some amazing graffiti art.
Yea man that would be great. I'm very curious.
Holy shit no!
It's all about the driver.
I have not noticed that. That's pretty cool.
I would totally rock a Heavy Cleaner outfit with my Firecrest.
Yep! Also tires popping and flattening.
That's absolutely awesome man. Thanks.
Also shot a fish tank and the water spilled out onto the carpet and it was soaked.
Also the soundtrack is excellent. It def helps set the mood and tone.
Ever wonder if the animals are infected as well? I mean the birds are literally flying in and out of the DZ!
Something bit me!
Yea you're right. BL2 will always hold a special place in my heart.
Yea dude. I try to enter some of those buildings but I guess not.
Haha. That's good.
I couldn't of said it better myself.
I'd muck around in the UG for that.
I'm gonna have to try this.

Oh yes. That is what kept farming interesting. There were different weapon types and different manufacturers. You want a pistol that shoots explosives rounds? Go Torgue. You want a rocket launcher that obliterates everything within 3 miles? Go Maliwan!
Wtf?! I've never noticed that.
Yes I understand real life firearms. I own several but the fact that in this game it glows is what I was referring to in the "details of the game."
Damn this is what I'm talking about!

WRITING.TITLE: Songs Coming From The Radios
WRITING.TEXT: I don't know if this has already been asked but does anybody know if the songs coming from the radios in the different house districts are original songs by real artists or original songs created by massive?
Then would the group's turrets and mines hurt friendlies as well? I like the OP suggestion. Slow down strafing.

Yea...internet is a helluva drug...
But I enjoyed your commentary.
Remember. Dicks are always bigger on the internet.
Damn dude. That's solid.
Yea I watched his vid too. And I totally agree with him.
He stated why he doesn't PVP. And made a series to make it better.

I understand what you're saying but you're only used to reloading while sprinting cause that was originally implemented from the beginning. Like many other things, Massive has changed the original content to suit their needs. He makes a compelling argument that other shooters don't allow reloading while sprinting because it promotes tactical play and not just convulsing around between mags.
Marco is an excellent gamer but he's more of a PVPer and from watching him I feel that he is biased to the skills he has and the DZ. He likes to theory and build and his research is amazing.
This is like...the best idea I've ever heard.

100%. He's a smart dude and used the broken mechanics in the game to his advantage. And who can blame him? But he does realize that the broken aspects need to be fixed so I tip my hat to him for that. That being said, I don't think Marco would enjoy the DZ as much if these things were fixed.
Yea, you caught me. I'm Skill-Up.
Intelligent discussions and debates don't happen anymore. They turn to verbal warfare and devolve to childish banter.
Oh to be young and fruitful. I admire your tenacity and attitude. Good for you. I hope you keep loving this game just as much as I do. I miss the beginning...
That's the most asinine comment yet.
That's interesting.

He lists the games he played PVP on and pointed out what makes them different and what works. Yes, the DZ is unique. Yes, there's not another game out there like the DZ. Yes, he rarely plays the Dz. He doesn't like going into the DZ because of what he thinks is wrong with it. It's his opinion and I agree with a lot of it. I've played the games he's mentioned too and it's fair and balanced. So therefore am I also someone that doesn't get the DZ?

I'm gonna give a basketball analogy. The great players never become great coaches. It's usually the ones that weren't good enough and sat on the bench and absorbed the game and broke down the schemes and gained the knowledge that turn out to be amazing coaches. Skill-Up isn't the best and he acknowledges that in his commentaries. However, it doesn't take the best player to understand how and what works.
Someone just learned to read!

Excellent reply Skill-Up. One of the reasons I'm subscribed to you is not only the content you bring but the manner in which you bring it. Supplying information and education without sounding pretentious but respectful on a consistent basis is difficult; especially when the voices on the internet can be harsh and idiotic. Please do continue to be a positive force.
That's like...you're opinion, man.
Sorry but how is that selfish? Also, where did you get your sociolinguistics degree?
Bahahahahahaha!!!
Butthurt City?
It's a necessary good.
He ganked him?
This is simply a case of getting what he deserved.
It doesn't matter if on PC, console or a Walmart parking lot; he dished it and then got served a nice big plate of "lulz".
The dude got killed. Whether or not it's on PC is irrelevant. There are proper players on all platforms.

I'm telling you it's irrelevant because depending on the platform the gameplay dictates the outcome. PC players have more control therefore the aiming is faster and more accurate while on consoles it's more difficult. It would be like a comparing a minor league team to a major league. Same game but different skill level. My point is that you're playing against the competition that's afforded to you. And again, what does this have to do with OP?
Dude just enjoy the vid. He survived. It's hilarious. It doesn't always have to be about skill.

This has happened to me many times. While engaging in a PVP I start shooting knowing my health is gonna go down so I wait a split second till the last segment to pop my medkit. I know I hit the damn medkit and booster but died anyway. Only to see the green splash from my booster floating above my cold dead body.
Yes, I am whining. No, I will not join them. Why? Cause I'm not a sheep. The problem is this is not what Massive intended the DZ to be. It's all about damage control at this point.
1239 hours.
Damn...
I won't be either.

I hear what you are saying. Maybe it's all in the manner of how the damage is proc'ed. With Nimble I have to first get to cover (which means I'm still for a second) then identify another source of cover then perform the move. Once I get to the destination (which I'm vulnerable again cause I'm standing still) then I have to identify the agent and start shooting within the 5 second period. I'm playing on XBone with a controller and it takes a lot of practice to execute this properly consistently. I do feel like I'm using this as intended. On the other hand, hitting a button to proc competent/adept then switching weapons is a lot faster and efficient. Also, the talent lasts for 10 seconds. This is an exploit in my opinion. It doesn't really matter I guess. My choice to play this game "exploiting" other mechanics.
This game will never be "fixed".
I didn't get ganked.

I do have a DE set and I've played around with it. It's quite fun and different indeed. However, yet again, I wish they would change who got the kill by the person who put them in the downed state rather than the final blow.
He did kill me. It just took him a little longer than he expected. Which isn't any longer without Nimble.

I agree it could be the lag. But I never got folded this fast ever in the DZ. This is no exaggeration. From full health to dead in less than a second. From medkit plus booster to dead in a second. What?!
Please explain what it could be then.
Do you have a source?

It's a combination of things. 1) There isn't another game out on the market right now that interests me 2) Most of the friends online play TD 3) I have invested too much time and want to see it through to the end 4) I truly love this game. The attention to detail and the unique experience is addictive. Even though it is rotten at its core, TD keeps providing entertainment for me with all it's flaws.
Yea dude seriously. I don't understand how they don't see how certain weapons and skills and talents will affect the game pre-release. Shit, look at the recent PTS.

So, then what is killing me so fast? If it isn't the shotgun talents then what's obliterating me? How much more armor and health must I stack? I already have 480,000 stamina with 55.8 armor. Exactly how do I combat this?

WRITING.TEXT: That is interesting. I never thought about that.
Can't. Stop. Watching. Jason Bateman continues to impress. Also, really cool foreshadowing with the opening "O" in every episode. It keeps you looking out for the clues.

Right after a cold open, the letter "O" appears for Ozark. Then a cross hair appears in the center of the "O". Each quadrant has a symbol. Each symbol represents key turning points or symbolisms for the plot in the episode.

WRITING.TITLE: "O" is for Ozark and Oh My...
WRITING.TEXT: 10 hours. That's how long I sat in front of my television watching Ozark. Rarely do I shoo away friends and being social for a tv show but I could not get my butt off my couch for 10 hours straight. I admire the quality that Netflix brings to the living rooms with Ozark. The only reason I gave this show a chance was for Jason Bateman. Loved him in AD and every comedic role he filled in movies but I didn't know he could tap into a dramatic role and pull it off with such ease. Ozark brings the heightened tension and plausible scenarios with such unsavory characters that I've missed since Breaking Bad. But dare I say I think I'm enjoying Ozark more than BB! And Laura Linney is a delight! EDIT: Also the "O" after the cold starts for every episode reveals four symbols that foreshadow what happens in that episode. Really cool idea. It keeps you engaged to figure it out.
I know right! The writing and acting is excellent. And the pace is just perfect. There's never a lull in the story and they sprinkle the right amount of tension.
Absolutely. I didn't see the trailer either.
I'm gonna have to check it out now.
I'm on pins and needles. The season ender was a shocker.
That's unfortunate. Episode 8 where it showed how they ended working for the cartel is one of my favorite episodes.
You won't be disappointed. Also no Skylar so...

To me, BB had this long story arc about White and his battle with cancer and the cartel and teased you from time to time with the future and the background with small samples. The fear and terror from the cartel didn't really kick in till the later seasons. Here in Ozark, the terror begins from chapter one.

WRITING.TITLE: The older I get the more I'm careful about what goes in my mouth cause I'm worried about how it will come out the other end at the most inappropriate time.

WRITING.TEXT: Oh my god. The last time I went on a mountain hike I took a double dose of Imodium AD just to make sure I won't have to poop in the woods next to bears. Worst mistake of my life. I was already dehydrated and had been munching on fiber rich bars and beef jerky. I didn't poop for four days. The drive back home my buddies wanted to have a nice meal. We stopped at a steak house. I knew I'd be in trouble so I tried to let out my contents. I sat on that toilet for twenty minutes. I pushed and pushed but nothing would come out until it finally happened. The only way I can describe the scene is like when you open a champagne bottle and the cork fiercely explodes out with strict determination. The best poop of my life...
Yep. Don't forget the churros.
You white, you're Gary Oldman.

WRITING.TITLE: Help me dispel some Windows10 vs MacOS myths
WRITING.TEXT: I've been a MacOS user since 2008. My iMac has treated me well without any hiccups other than doubling up on the RAM a few years ago. Now I'm on the market for a laptop and am seriously considering switching to Windows 10. Build quality isn't a concern for me. I think now more than ever the difference between choosing one over the other is the OS experience. I've had many Windows products in the past and they all have never lasted me longer than 2-3 years. In the beginning, the experience is zippy and lag free but then overtime the sluggishness just brings frustrations. I've never had this problem with my iMac. Why is this? Or does the user require some hands-on maintenance to help lengthen the overall life expectancy of the Windows platform? Also, is malware protection still necessary? Any advice helps.
This is all good advice. I've been looking at the Surface brand lineup, leaning towards the Surface Laptop. A friend of mine just bought a XPS15 and have had some driver issues.

WRITING.TITLE: Surface users, how has your experience been so far?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm looking to switch over from MacOS and the Surface line looks mighty intriguing. Please be brutal with your honesty!
Well shit. Care to elaborate?
Oh my god.
How often do you reset?
Excellent. This makes me feel more confident.
This is exactly what I wanted to hear. Finally something positive.
In your experience, are hardware issues a rarity?
What kind of complaints on Windows do you speak of?
I don't think I'd mind 10S. I won't be downloading too many apps and from what I can tell the Store has all the options I need.
Do you mind sharing your specs? I'll be doing some video and photo editing.
Thanks!
This is excellent stuff. Thanks.
Well said. Thank you.
This was a perfect response.
Thanks for the reply. Do you find the Surface lineup to be on the well-built side?
What kind of programs are you running? Has the performance been pretty good?

The i5/ 8GB/ 256GB version seems to be the sweet spot. I haven't heard of the yellowing screen phenomenon though. I'll be doing mostly some photo editing and light video editing but nothing intensive like 4K. Do you think the specs would suffice?
Nice! And what kind of work do you do on the laptop?
From what I understand the internal fan rarely kicks in. And even if it does it is super quite.
That's good to know. Thanks!

WRITING.TITLE: How important is read/write speed?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm about to pull the trigger on the Surface Laptop (yes, I understand, for the money, I can get something better). From the reviews, the Laptops SSD performance seems to be on the weak side compared to its competitors. The main tasks I'll be performing: Internet browsing Lightroom editing (Light) Premiere editing I am in no way tech savvy (obviously) and have posted previously before on this sub and I feel the honest opinions from this community are the best opinions. Any input is welcome. Thanks.
Thanks for the input.

In terms of character back stories: it dives deep into Handsome Jack and Claptrap mostly. It also shouldn #8217;t hinder you from Tales. The gameplay I feel is superior to BL1/2 with the zero gravity mechanic, ground stomps and freezing debuffs. But replayability lacks considerably compared to BL1 and definitely BL2. Some bosses are not refarmable and the gear are mostly rehashed and renamed from BL2. However, if you enjoy BL2 then the Presequel is worth a shot. Every character is awesome to play to almost max LVL and you #8217;ll end up wishing that a couple shows up in future iterations. Happy looting! Edit: I freakin love Athena and her skill trees. I wish I could play her on BL2.

Exactly. The only replayability is trying to max out the characters along with specific COMs. The gear doesn #8217;t really matter in this game much in which kinda goes against what BL is but builds are where it #8217;s at.
Damnit, now I #8217;ve got the itch, I guess I #8217;ll buy this game again now.

I like Athena for her elemental prowess. She #8217;s all about maintains stacks and using her shield to your advantage. Claptrap is fun but also kinda RNG depending on his abilities. He is def OP though. To be candid, I would start with Athena but you #8217;re gonna end up playing all the characters. Trust me.

WRITING.TITLE: Queso and chips at Chipotle
WRITING.TEXT: Dallasite here. I #8217;ve never really been a fan of Chipotle and haven #8217;t eaten there in almost a year. Then I hear about this new queso #8220;done Chipotle way #8221; and I abstained. Until right now. First of all, this is not queso. This is a goopy puddle of cheese. I don #8217;t taste the tomatillo and it #8217;s terribly under seasoned. And! It #8217;s $3.45 just for the queso and chips! My entire meal cost $12.20 without a drink. I understand most people don #8217;t enjoy the synthetic flavor of American or Velveeta but I #8217;ve grown up on this shit my entire life. All the Tex-Mex restaurants around here have a synthetic cheese version of queso and it #8217;s freakin delicious. Without Velveeta, the melted dip is just missing something. Anybody else feel this way about Chipotle and their failed attempt at convincing me?
I haven #8217;t tried Chiloso yet. I do like Freebird #8217;s queso though and Qdoba. Chuy #8217;s queso is pretty damn tasty IMHO.
Qdoba is great. I haven #8217;t been up north but I #8217;d imagine Tex-Mex to be quite rare.
And the price!

Grinding for gear is gonna be somewhat rough at this stage. If you #8217;re in TVHM then I #8217;d farm Terra for Hide shield. If solo farm the Love Thumper. A Ninja COM that boosts Killing Blow and Backstab would suffice.
Damn straight.
Yea I don #8217;t know what the chef heads at the big Office was thinking. This is a disgrace. Sometimes you just shouldn #8217;t mess with something that #8217;s delicious.
Agreed. I don #8217;t understand the love. I #8217;ve never came away satisfied. Just full of regret.
Another reason for me to move to #127464; #127462;!
Taco trucks are amazing.

The Road stayed with me for a long time. The scenario isn #8217;t new, the overall color just like the world portrayed is depressing. I agree that it #8217;s not a movie that is rewatchable probably because the main characters and the shitty situations they get into was replayed in my head for over a week. However, I will play certain scenes on my player from time to time cause it #8217;s just so damn good. Two in particular: the scene when they find the underground food supply (it brings a little light into their lives) and the #8220;abandoned #8221; house scene where they find the human livestock (sheer terror).
The audience had to of shared the sentiment with the kid. He felt safe and food was finally abundant. Why leave? Cause the adult really understands what #8217;s going on with the world.

I consider BL2 to be my most favorite game of all time. Not even close to anything else. Even nostalgia like Super Mario, Zelda, Mega Man or even Vice City don #8217;t even come close to holding a candle to BL2. When this game first came out I was hooked from the opening music sequence. This was the first game that introduced me to addiction, hoarding and research. The gameplay is unique, not because it pioneered the FPS looter shooter genre, but because with each play through with each character with different gear with different groups changes the experience everytime. The replayability is off the charts and if you get bored doing one thing you can easily do something else and it #8217;s a fresh game. BL2 will still be played ten years from now. Even when BL3 comes out, BL2 will still be either on the shelf or digital library winking at me to pick it the fuck up and play.

I really didn #8217;t mind TPS. I enjoyed the 60+ hours I put into it. The thing that was really lacking was fresh gear. Most of the legendaries that you grinders for was rehashed from BL2 so that kinda sucked the fun out of original content.
Love the Hornet. Just wish it came in different elements then it would be amazing.
What the hell is this?!

Such an inconvenience.

WRITING.TITLE: The Toys That Made Us | I laughted like a kid
WRITING.TEXT: If y'all haven't checked out TTTMU on Netflix you need to give it a chance. The inception of some of these toys and how they marketed it to kids is amazing. This was a hilarious peek behind the curtains and into the minds of the creators. I especially loved Episode 3: He-Man. The banter and clashes these people had can only be described as "kids in a toy store". It also shows how a toy company back in the 80's really was pulling shit out of their asses and hoping that something would stick. And the interviews given by the employees definitely proves that working for a toy company back in the day was pure joy. Also brought back some fond childhood memories.
I enjoyed every episode. Very entertaining doc on childhood nostalgia.
At the end of the season I wished there were more episodes.
You have a point.
I agree. I hope they cover TMNT and Legos.

WRITING.TITLE: Italians of Reddit, movies (especially Gangster flicks like The Godfather) always show Italians eating pasta, pasta, pasta and more pasta with a loaf of bread for every meal. Now this can #8217;t be true right? What really is a typical dinner for Italians?

WRITING.TITLE: The Punisher [Netflix] | I am surprised
WRITING.TEXT: Right off the bat, I don't know the lore of The Punisher, I have never read a single comic book; the last anything about The Punisher that i have seen is the rendition by Thomas Jane; and I'm not the biggest fan of "superhero drama". Countless articles, threads and recommendations forced me to give this series a chance. Much reluctance was there but the one driving force that gave me hope was Jon Bernthal. I enjoyed his portrayal of Shane on The Walking Dead, and by far to this day, he is still my favorite character and Jon did not disappoint. His thespian prowess continues to impress me and I await with such giddy for the next installment of this series. The demeanor of the character, the ruthlessness of justice, the uncanny ability to draw me in to understand what exactly The Punisher stands for, has quenched my thirst for revenge. I am now a believer in the series of superheroes that can be done correctly like how "The Dark Knight" did for cinematic superheroes. I love you Jon
Your breath smells of bok.
Get it checked dude.
Good luck.
Thanks for the recommendation. I #8217;ll give it a watch.

WRITING.TITLE: #8220;Leather #8221; on car dash is plastic stitching
Planet Earth II - The Scarlett Heart
WRITING.TEXT: I'm late to Planet Earth II. Though I enjoyed the original PE when it came out ten years ago, I finally took the time to watch all six episodes in one sitting. Every second of this series is pure entertainment. Sir David Attenborough soothed my ears while the stunning cinematography made my eyes smile for six hours straight. The one particular scene that stood out for me was Episode Six; where they concentrated on a bowerbird in the city. According to Wikipedia: "Bowerbirds...are renowened for their unique courtship behaviour, where males build a structure and decorate it with sticks and brightly coloured objects in an attempt to attract a mate." This one bowerbird had collected strings, plastic lids, toy cars and other colorful mad-made objects to place in his collection of seduction. But it wasn't enough. He needed his pi #232;ce de r #233; #183;sis #183;tance. So, he went to one of his "neighbors" and stole a small fabric heart in bright attractive red. Surely this was gonna get the job done. He absconds with it and beds the heart in his domain. It works. Another bowerbird notices his diligence and the primal game begins. I won't spoil the rest for those who haven't had the privilege of watching PE2. All I can say is you're missing out. The BBC really knows how to package a documentary. PS, I love you Sir Attenborough...
JERRY! JERRY! JERRY!
I didn #8217;t watch last years super bowl. What commercial is this?

This ambush did force me to play differently but I don #8217;t see why they would have to change anything about NPCs and their HP/Damage. By keeping the #8220;ambush modifier #8221; it cements this game as a cover shooter. I actually enjoyed this GE more than the last one and would love for this to continue.

If you want higher difficulty then join a four man group in incursions and other legendary content and then test your mettle. An RPG should reward you with a gameplay that makes you feel powerful and that #8217;s enjoyable.

WRITING.TITLE: Use NPCs as your ally when extracting solo
WRITING.TEXT: I generally like to solo the DZ. I #8217;ll accept invites once I a while but the majority of the time I #8217;d rather have Netflix playing on the side and clear landmarks and farm DivTech alone. For solo players, extracting can be a giant flame to rogue moths. So, whenever possible I will use the NPCs to my advantage. Every extract point has at least two enter/exits. I #8217;ll call the extract on one far point of the zone. This will alert the NPCs to arrive. Then I will put a few rounds in the NPCs and then run under or around to the other side of the extract point and wait. If my XP meter starts going up then I can assume two things: either another faction has shown up and it #8217;s all out warfare OR other agents have shown up and are clearing out the aggroed NPCs. At this point I have two options: fight or flight. If the other agents are still distracted then I #8217;ll wait till the last 10-15 seconds, drop a shock turret and place my loot on the rope. Or you can escape and try at a different location. I #8217;m sure other agents have tried this method but for those who are new give this a shot. 60% of the time it works everytime.
Will do.
What #8217;s Freddy #8217;s?
Perfect.
Nice. I don #8217;t think there #8217;s one of those here in DFW.

Exactly. I #8217;ve unloaded at the 60 sec mark and that rarely ends well for me. I #8217;ve also put my loot at like 12 secs and have the rope cut with literally a millisecond to spare. But it #8217;s the DZ and it #8217;s what I love.
Remember the time when rope cutting wasn #8217;t a thing. That implementation just made going rogue more appealing. There #8217;s also an accommodation for rope cutting.
Absolutely. When Striker, the more NPCs the better.
Well I will say the rope cutting has one advantage. If they do cut it and they kill you it gives you an additional 150 secs to get it back from then.
Ha! I #8217;d cut rope just to get that accommodation.

That #8217;s how I got one of The House in the DZ. As soon as I saw the red spire my eyes opened wide and as I got closer to the drop I prayed and hoped for a good roll House. And I was blessed. Immediately I worked up multiple scenarios in my head of which extract point to go to. I just chose the nearest one to a safe point and used this tactic. Oddly enough it was a heavy that proc #8217;d my nomad once and my ult while roping but I survived! That was a good day in the DZ.
That would be epic. Also would like the option to BFG the chopper.
That #8217;s what sets the DZ apart from other games.
Agent? Yes. Man? Sure. Wise? Meh.
Exactly.
Yes this is a good point.
Nice. I usually only extract in DZ4, 5 and 6. I feel I have the advantage with the multi tier extract points.
It is a sight to see two factions having at it. It #8217;s quite hilarious. Once I did lose track of time of extracting cause I was watching cleaners and rikers have a massive battle.

It does start slow. I think the writers tried to bring in new audiences when it went to Netflix and introduce the main characters. However, I felt it got better a few episodes in. Still doesn #8217;t hold a candle to the first three seasons though. Especially the third. That #8217;s when they pulled all the stops.
By far my favorite TV series of all time. I #8217;ve seen all seasons at least five times.
Haha. Yea I #8217;ll do that sometimes as well.

I #8217;m down for high-risk-high-reward. That #8217;s what the DZ lacks. It should be like back in the day when going rogue and dying you #8217;d lose a shit ton of DZ XP but that #8217;s still not enough. It should be more like if you go rogue and you die then you lose all your gear including what you #8217;re using. That #8217;s right. Weapons and gear. If not then at least a 10 min cooldown from entering the DZ cause you #8217;re being interrogated by Lau for disobedience. She #8217;s just keep whining cause her body can #8217;t seem to heal.
Touch #233;. There #8217;s always money in the first three seasons.
I run 6 piece Sex Predator.
Yes. 90 secs to wait then 60 secs for the liftoff.
That #8217;s exactly it.
It always is satisfying.
I #8217;m saying it #8217;s an optical illusion. It #8217;s the pattern in my pants.

Well since it #8217;s a looter and RNG can be quite unfair, you just have to stick with it. I enjoy this game. Probably because I can slap on different gear set and play differently so it keeps it fresh. I #8217;ve grinded my ass off every GE and in right now I have: 6 piece classy Nomad 6 piece classy D3 6 piece classy Alpha 6 piece classy Hunters 6 piece classy Banshee 6 piece classy FireCrest 6 piece classy Tac Almost all the sets but yet again RNG can be a bitch. And it can get you down and be very frustrating. I only need a Predator backpack to complete my set and it just won #8217;t drop. Lucky for us all, looks like they might tweak the drop rates on classy gear on the next update. At least that #8217;s the rumor. Bottom line, if you enjoy the game then I #8217;d just keep playing and eventually the pieces will fall for you. Also, try farming Resistance. That #8217;s what I #8217;ve been doing lately. Pretty reliable. EDIT: drop And farm LZ bosses
Haha. I took a break for 6 months I wonder how high it would be if I didn #8217;t take a hiatus.
When the Commendations started I was surprised with how many I haven #8217;t unlocked. Like NPC kills. I surely thought I had maxed it out three times over but I just barely finished it.

The DZ isn #8217;t that much better in your favor. I would run the LZ bosses every four hours; if you have four characters then that #8217;s 60 chances for exotics and classys in two hours. Also, run Pier 93 for one or two chances at a loot box. This is by far your safest bet. Don #8217;t worry about the DZ. Cause if you don #8217;t have a group to run the DZ and you happened to get a gear to extract your chances of getting out alive is slim. But stick with it. It #8217;s a pain in the ass but this is grinding.
No shit?! Well that explains a lot.
God bless you.
That #8217;s insane man.
That #8217;s dedication dude.
Oh shit my bad. I meant Skulls. You #8217;re right.
So you #8217;re saying out getting the 3 out of 4.
I didn #8217;t know this.

WRITING.TITLE: What is your favorite scene from Twin Peaks?
WRITING.TEXT: One of my favorites is when Coop and Ed go in disguise to One Eyed Jacks as oral surgeons in Realization Time. Ed blows his cover by telling Blackie that he #8217;s a gas station owner and she tells him #8220;I #8217;ve got a car out back with a serious root canal problem #8221;. Ed quickly responds with #8220;I was hopin #8217; you #8217;d need a little gum work, #8217;cause I #8217;d sure like to take a look under your hood. #8221; Blackie is pleased and tells Coop she likes Ed. And Coop is disgusted/stunned with Ed #8217;s reply and says #8220;He #8217;s a prince. #8221; Has me rolling everytime!
Ha yes!
Beautiful scene.
There really are so many.
I agree. I was expecting Bobby to explode on him but he actually listened and was thankful.
Yea you #8217;re right. I guess watching it on Netflix for some reason screws with my mind.

WRITING.TITLE: RIP Don Carter, You will be missed in Dallas
Pulling off the price tag from an expensive purchase feels like pulling the pin from a grenade.

WRITING.TEXT: Very nice.
Haha. I hope not. I #8217;m not asking for a nerf in terms of bleed but maybe changing 9k stam to 9k firearms. It seems more reasonable to be a glass cannon with that kind of power.
Agreed.
Very nice. I took out a four man Manhunt group solo with this build.
My understanding is to get the extra percentages for chance I #8217;ll have to get through weapon talents like vicious?

Dropping a box and running in and out is what I do and I understand it #8217;s not a great counter but still viable. Also the best counter is to make them bleed first. Like I said, toning down the bleed would be ok with me. Or at least make the 9k threshold Firearms so you #8217;re a true glass cannon.

WRITING.TITLE: ELI5: was The Brady Bill effective towards homicides with firearms?
WRITING.TEXT: Most of the research and articles I have found show numbers relating the blocking of felons and criminals from purchasing firearms; also suicide rates by firearms. I feel most of the #8220;news #8221; articles are skewed by bias. Is there any definitive proof with black and white numbers to back up the bill?
That #8217;s exactly what I #8217;m looking for. The things that happened and recorded. Like did the number of homicides from firearms go down?
Thanks for your input.
Their annoyance is my pleasure.
I #8217;m on my fourth iPhone. I pretty much use all google apps. The only iOS related app I use is iMessage. To sum up, iMessage is the only reason I have a +$600 phone...

Exactly. If Android would have something similar to iMessage I #8217;d be on board. I like the devices by Google and was a click away from switching to the Pixel 2XL AND carrier for it but a friend iMessaged me and I folded.

WRITING.TITLE: New Plastic

WRITING.TEXT: Hands down my favorite movie of all time. I have to watch it at least once a month. Line by line, quotable. Memorable characters, every single one. Made me fall in love with White Russians.
Raw was delicious but I don #8217;t know if I consider it a Horror flick. More like Indie-Drama with a splash of blood. Then again I #8217;m not a movie critic.
I guess I will be placing Mute in that category then.

WRITING.TITLE: Gal Gadot doppelganger
WRITING.TEXT: So, I just rewatched Bring It On on Netflix, haven't seen it in like 17 years, and there is a character named Darcy. She is a brunette, quite fit with distinct eye brows and my immediate reaction was "holy shit, Gal was in Bring It On!" But a quick IMDB search proves wrong. Darcy is played by Tsianina Joelson. Wow, to me at least, the similarity is uncanny. Please, someone back me up on this!
You #8217;re probably right.

Mint eh? Will do.

Interesting! I will purchase these. This actually is quite helpful. Thank you.

No lakes, ponds, reservoirs, watersheds, seas, oceans within sight.

Fairly dry. Sprinkled a couple of days ago.
These actually work?
Good tips. Thanks.

WRITING.TITLE: LPT: Whenever someone had a bad day and they #8217;re being cathartic, just listen. Don #8217;t speak. Don #8217;t give advice. Don #8217;t interrupt. Don #8217;t pretend to listen. Be a pal and be a sponge. This is the most good you can do.

WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;ve lived and learned.
